author: Perez Hilton
title: Surgeon Jumps To His Death After Split From TV Personality Wife
text:
2/13/2017 5:25   R.I.P. • Sad Sad • Facebook • Mental Health • Depression • Viral: News 
A top thoracic surgeon committed suicide two weeks after he was divorced from his wife. 
According to The Daily Voice , Dr. Robert Ashton (above) jumped to his death from the George Washington Bridge at around 8:40 a.m. on Saturday. 
The 52-year-old had just split from his wife Dr. Jennifer Ashton , chief women's health correspondent for ABC News . 
Related: Dairy Queen Manager Charged With Bullying Teen Into Suicide 
The pair lived across the street from each other in Fort Lee, New Jersey, which is in the shadow of the bridge. They had two teenage children. 
On Sunday, Jennifer shared a heartfelt tribute to her ex in a Facebook post, saying he "helped so many and we will remember his warmth generosity and kindness." 
Though she didn't say what drove her ex to suicide, the TV personality said his death should serve as a wakeup call to all those with a loved one battling depression. 
Robert had been a thoracic surgery director at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx, and chief thoracic surgeon at Hackensack University Medical Center. 
He was also a healthcare contributor on Fox News and MSNBC , and had made appearances on The Today Show , NBC Nightly News , and CBS World News . 
The surgeon's body was recovered at Hazard's Dock in Palisades Interstate Park shortly after he jumped. 
Just awful. Our hearts go out to his loved ones as they get through this tragedy.
